description: Euclid-Mullin sequence (A000945) with initial value a(1)=97 instead of a(1)=2.
links: Robert Price, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..45
A. R. Booker, S. A. Irvine, The Euclid-Mullin graph, arXiv preprint arXiv:1508.03039, 2015
mathematica: a[1]=97; a[n_] := First[ Flatten[ FactorInteger[ 1+Product[ a[ j ], {j, 1, n-1} ] ] ] ]; Array[a, 10]
prog: (PARI) lpf(n)=factor(n)[1, 1]first(m)=my(v=vector(m)); v[1]=97; for(i=2, m, v[i]=lpf(1+prod(j=1, i-1, v[j]))); v; \\ _Anders Hellstr√∂m_, Aug 31 2015
author: _Labos Elemer_
